Metric-based Fault Prediction for Spreadsheets

Resources related to the paper "Metric-based Fault Prediction for Spreadsheets" submitted to "IEEE Transactions on Software Engineering".

View on GitHub

Overview of the provided material:

  • Catalog of metrics (extended descriptions)
  • Datasets in raw and filtered forms
  • Evaluation code, scripts, and results
  • Tool download and description
  • Online appendix providing detailed results of experiments and high-resoultion plots

Datasets

Spreadsheet corpora as originally published.

  • Enron Errors
  • INFO1
  • EUSES

Spreadsheet corpora as used for the studies described in our work.

  • Enron Errors
  • INFO1
  • EUSES

Tables (csv files) containing the metric measurements and fault information for all spreadsheets.

  • Enron Errors
  • INFO1
  • EUSES

Evaluation Code

Python code that implements the functionality that is used by the individual evaluation scripts to import and export data, as well as to initialize and employ the machine-learning functionalities of scikit-learn.

The evaluation scripts are used to run the individual experiments.

All evaluation results of the individual experiments (encoded in csv, txt, and json file formats).

Fritz Tool

Fritz is the tool (in the form of an executable jar file) that was used to compute the metric values for each of the input datasets. Additional Information regarding the requirements, functionalities, and usage of Fritz is available at the tool web page

Online Appendix

The online appendix provides additional material, referred to from the paper.
Full-sized plots and descriptions of all results of studies 1 and 2:

  • Study 1: Individual metrics as fault predictors
  • Study 2: Fault prediction with multiple metrics

Descriptions and results of additional experiments that were not part of the main studies, but were discussed at the specified locations in the manuscript:

  • 6.4: Evaluation of combined models
  • 7.2.2: Effect of limiting the set of features for Random Forest classifiers
  • 7.2.2: Most important features of trained Random Forest classifiers
2018_Metric-based-Fault-Prediction-for-Spreadsheets is maintained by pwkoch. This page was generated by GitHub Pages.
